intro: Rhabdocaulon erythrostachys, commonly known as the red-stalked rhabdocaulon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its striking red or purple stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or violet in color. Native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
